arm_group.description: Apply traditional acupuncture to prevent the migraine attack according to TCM theory
sham-acupoint will be penetrated for migraine prophylaxis.
No acupuncture nor other methods will be conducted in this group.

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypothesis: Acupuncture obtains an abiding effect on migraine prophylaxis Design: A
      open-label randomized controlled trial. 249 participants will be included. Three arms:
      acupuncture in acupoint-meridian， non-acupoint-meridian group, and waiting list.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim: to attest the abiding efficacy and safety of acupuncture for migraine prophylaxis
      Design: A open-label randomized controlled trial will be performed in Chengdu, Hunan and
      Chongqing province. Two hundred and forty-three participants will be randomly assign to
      acupoint-meridian group, non-acupoint-meridian group, and wait-and-see group. Each
      participants will receive 20 sessions of acupuncture in 4 weeks, with a duration of 30
      minutes in a session. After all the treatments was accomplished, there will be 5 times
      follow-ups in the impending every 4 weeks. The primary outcome is frequency of migraine
      attacks 16 weeks after inclusion. Secondary outcomes include frequency of migraine attacks
      at the 4th and 24th week, headache severity, MSQ(Migraine Specific Quality of Life
      Questionnaire MSQ Version2.1), etc.

intervention.description: apply acupuncture to prevent the migraine attack

clinical_study.official_title: A Continuous Study on Abiding Effect of Acupuncture for Migraine Treatment

other_outcome.description: to observe the change of MSQ
other_outcome.measure: MSQ(Migraine Specific Quality of Life Questionnaire MSQ Version2.1)
other_outcome.time_frame: the day of inclusion and 4th week after inclusion

other_outcome.description: an outcome to indicate the expectation of patient towards acupuncture treatment for migraine

overall_official.affiliation: Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

oversight_info.authority: China: Ministry of Science and Technology

primary_outcome.description: to assess the frequency of migraine attacks at the 16th week after inclusion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

secondary_outcome.description: to assess the frequency of migraine attacks at the 4th and 24th week respectively
to evaluate the change of severity of headache
